name: Drone Onsite Physical Inspection Checklist
description: Comprehensive onsite physical inspection checklist for drone systems performed at the hangar with direct access

metadata.author: RemoteTI
metadata.safetyNote: IMPORTANT: ENSURE OVERALL SAFETY AND ACCURACY - Safety First - This checklist is critical for the safe operation of the drone. Proper execution is essential.

general: Safety First - This checklist is critical for the safe operation of the drone. Proper execution is essential.

Just Culture - We promote an environment of open and honest communication. Report any mistakes, incidents, or safety concerns without fear of blame. Your feedback helps improve our processes and enhances overall safety.
Attention to Detail - Carefully follow each task in the order presented. Do not skip any steps.
Use PPE - Always wear required safety gear.
Report Issues - Document any abnormalities or safety concerns immediately.
INSTRUCTION: KEEP THE DRONE POWERED ON UNTIL A TASK THAT EXPLICITLY TELLS YOU TO TURN IT OFF.

tasks.title: IMPORTANT: ENSURE OVERALL SAFETY AND ACCURACY
tasks.description:
Safety First - This checklist is critical for the safe operation of the drone. Proper execution is essential.
Just Culture - We promote an environment of open and honest communication. Report any mistakes, incidents, or safety concerns without fear of blame. Your feedback helps improve our processes and enhances overall safety.
Attention to Detail - Carefully follow each task in the order presented. Do not skip any steps.
Use PPE - Always wear required safety gear.
Report Issues - Document any abnormalities or safety concerns immediately.
INSTRUCTION: KEEP THE DRONE POWERED ON UNTIL A TASK THAT EXPLICITLY TELLS YOU TO TURN IT OFF.

tasks.title: PRS: Disarm the parachute system safely
tasks.description:
ALWAYS WEAR SAFETY GOGGLES AND HEARING PROTECTION WHEN HANDLING THE PRS FUSE.
Switch the parachute fuse just below the PRS tube to "SAFE".

tasks.title: INSTRUCTION: At arrival to hangar, verify that the spares batteries are fully charged
tasks.description: Otherwise, start charging again.

tasks.title: INSTRUCTION: Dry off the drone
tasks.description:
If applicable, carefully dry off any water, snow, or moisture on the drone.
This to prevent water from entering the drone during battery change.

tasks.title: SYSTEM: Initiate telemetry transfer
tasks.description:
Align the drone for easy and safe access, ensuring telemetry transfer is possible.
Unscrew the safety cap over the Ethernet port on the bottom of the drone.
Attach the telemetry Ethernet cable.
Confirm telemetry transfer is active: nav lights blinking yellow.
When the transfer is complete the blinking will return to red, green or blue.

tasks.title: PARACHUTE SYSTEM: Verify yellow lid is fitted correctly
tasks.description:
Visually inspect the yellow lid for structural integrity and absence of cracks on the perimeter.
Verify that the lid is evenly pressed down on the tube.
Verify no parachute fabric is protruding outside the yellow lid.

tasks.title: PARACHUTE SYSTEM: Verify parachute tube is mounted correctly
tasks.description:
Visually inspect that the parachute tube is securely mounted on the drone and is fully seated in the drone.
Inspect for any structural damage to the tube.

tasks.title: PARACHUTE SYSTEM: Verify parachute line and line collector is OK
tasks.description:
Ensure the line collector is intact.
Confirm there is no excessive slack in the line.
Ensure the line is correctly retained in the line backpack.

tasks.title: PARACHUTE SYSTEM: Verify that the parachute fuse switch is OK
tasks.description:
Verify that the fuse switch is structurally intact.
Verify that the red cap on the switch is mounted.

tasks.title: DRONE STRUCTURE: Verify motor arms are OK
tasks.description: Inspect for any visual or structural damage.

tasks.title: DRONE STRUCTURE: Verify core is OK
tasks.description: Check the drone core for any visual cracks.

tasks.title: DRONE STRUCTURE: Verify landing gear has no visible damage and is stable
tasks.description:
Inspect the landing gear for structural soundness.
Check for cracks or damages.
Ensure the connection to the drone is secure, some play is acceptable.

tasks.title: PROPULSION SYSTEM: Verify propellers clean and OK
tasks.description:
Clean the propellers if necessary.
Verify propellers are structurally intact with no damages or cracks.
Inspect the leading and trailing edges for damages.

tasks.title: PROPULSION SYSTEM: Verify motors are OK
tasks.description:
Check for any visible damage on the motor rotors.
Verify that any motor doesn't feel rough, sounds abnormal, or differs from the others.
Spin the motors to ensure they move smoothly.
Confirm all motors spin similarly without abnormal sounds or vibrations.
Visually check that the orange cables between the ESC and the motor looks OK

tasks.title: PROPULSION SYSTEM: Verify motors have no axial play
tasks.description:
Verify that there is no axial play in the motor.
Hold the motor base and gently push/pull the bell up/down. No axial movement should be present.

tasks.title: PROPULSION SYSTEM: Verify ESCs are mounted correctly
tasks.description: Verify that there are no indications of the ESCs being loose.

tasks.title: PERIPHERALS: Verify 4G antennas mounted correctly
tasks.description:
Gently confirm the 4G antennas are firmly mounted on the drone.
Ensure two antennas point to the sides and two point angled down.

tasks.title: PERIPHERALS: Verify GPS masts mounted correctly
tasks.description:
Verify that both of the GPS masts are structurally ok.
Verify that both of the GPS are aimed forwards.

tasks.title: PERIPHERALS: Verify RealSense lenses are clean without damage
tasks.description:
Inspect both front and downward camera lenses for cleanliness and damage.
Remove dirt or fingerprints using dry utilities available in the hangar, do not use wet wipes.

tasks.title: PERIPHERALS: Verify OpticalFlow modules are OK
tasks.description:
Inspect the OpticalFlow module for cleanliness and damage.
The lens is not accessible so only verify that no dirt risks obscuring its view.

tasks.title: DOWNLIGHTS: Verify that the Downlight is mounted OK
tasks.description: Verify that it is structurally intact on the front right landing gear.

tasks.title: MINIFINDER: Verify that the MiniFinder is mounted
tasks.description: Verify that the MiniFinder and the holder looks structurally intact.

tasks.title: MARKING: Verify drone and AED markings are correct
tasks.description:
Ensure the drone is marked according to local regulations, permit number should be on one of the rear arms, starting with "SWEbneâ€¦"

Confirm the drone displays Onyx name and airframeID,
example Onyx name "E3001" airframeID 1234C01B1124E3001
Verify instructions are present for if the drone is found by the public, between middle and rear arms.
Check that the AED alarm device has a sticker with power-off instructions.

tasks.title: SYSTEM: If telemetry is complete, proceed with the checklist
tasks.description:
Confirm telemetry transfer is complete, blinking nav lights are not yellow.
If telemetry is not complete after 10 minutes: stop transfer and continue checklist.
Remove the Ethernet cable and store it safely.
Securely lock the Ethernet port cap.

tasks.title: PERIPHERALS: Verify that the ETH and USB caps are mounted
tasks.description:
Mount and verify that the ETH cap is screwed on and completely seals the port.
Mount and verify that the USB cap is screwed on and completely seals the port.

tasks.title: DRONE STRUCTURE: Open lids
tasks.description:
With a screwdriver, unscrew the 4 screws holding the lids together.
Open them so you have access to the batteries.

tasks.title: BATTERIES: Remove old batteries and verify their condition
tasks.description:
Using the battery unplugging tool, unplug both batteries.
Verify that the batteries look OK.

tasks.title: BATTERIES: Put old batteries on charge
tasks.description: Follow the instructions at the chagrin station.

tasks.title: INSTRUCTION: Align the drone perfectly
tasks.description:
Align the drone over the visual navigation marker.
Front landing gear should be placed on the two dots in front of the marker.
Ensure the front camera faces the correct direction.
Verify the drone body is perfectly aligned with the visual navigation markers.

tasks.title: DRONE STRUCTURE: Verify internal compartment is OK
tasks.description:
Ensure internal power cables are routed correctly and are structurally sound.
Check for any debris or dirt inside the drone.
Verify there are no residues or moisture present.

tasks.title: LIVEVIEW: Verify lenses are clean and camera undamaged
tasks.description:
Check that the LiveView camera is structurally OK.
Clean the lenses if necessary by using the microfibre cloth or dedicated lens brush, do not use wet wipes.

tasks.title: BATTERIES: Verify batteries are fully charged and in good condition
tasks.description:
Verify new batteries are fully charged, both over 50V.
Ensure batteries and connectors are undamaged.
Confirm batteries are clean and dry.

tasks.title: BATTERIES: Connect the odd number battery to the front position of the drone
tasks.description:
Place the battery in the drone and connect the battery.
Confirm that the connector is fully seated (no visible gap).
Ensure that the cables are routed so lids won't pinch them.

tasks.title: LIVEVIEW: Verify LiveView camera performs a startup calibration correctly
tasks.description:
Observe the camera moving to its end position after powering on.
Confirm it returns to the forward-facing position.

tasks.title: SYSTEM: Verify initial beeping of the flight controller is nominal
tasks.description:
During startup the flight controller takes between 5-10s to start up.
After the initial beeping it will stop beeping if kept still and untouched.

tasks.title: SYSTEM: Verify that the Nav lights show the correct colour
tasks.description:
Navlights should light in a snake pattern:
Green, if everything is OK.
Blue, if everything is OK and MedKit is mounted.
Otherwise, contact the pilot to assure status.

tasks.title: POWER SYSTEM: Verify the Onyx fan starts spinning
tasks.description:
Check that the fan on the bottom of the drone spins.
Be careful so you don't get your fingers stuck in the fan.

tasks.title: DOCUMENTATION: Note your name, drone Airframe ID, and battery set in the work order
tasks.description:
In the work order, press "Add note".
Write your name, the AirframeID, and the set of batteries mounted in the drone.
Example: "Oliver Wallin, 1124, F3".
On the E3 note the 4 digits before "E3" as the airframeID.

tasks.title: DRONE STRUCTURE: Close the lids
tasks.description:
Verify that the batteries are fully seated in their compartments.
Close the lids.
Verify no cables are pinched before tightening screws.
Screw on the screws, 2 per side using the lid tool.

tasks.title: POWER SYSTEM: Inspect contact surfaces of the umbilical for damage, soot or corrosion
tasks.description:
Inspect the copper surfaces on the umbilical on both the floor and the drone's landing gear.
Ensure there is no soot or residues from sparks.
Verify copper pins/pads are not bent or damaged.

tasks.title: POWER SYSTEM: Attach umbilical to the drone
tasks.description: Connect the umbilical next to the left landing gear and confirm that the connector is straight and fully connected.

tasks.title: MEDKIT: Verify that all utilities are included
tasks.description: Verify the MedKit contains all required items and are in good condition.

tasks.title: MEDKIT: Verify that the AED is in an operational condition
tasks.description:
Verify the AED being correctly placed inside the MedKit.
Check that the AED status is OK.
Confirm that the AED is dry, clean and free from visible damage.

tasks.title: WINCH: Thread the line through the red guide below the drone
tasks.description: Thread the line through the red guide, ensuring the line is routed correctly.

tasks.title: WINCH: Attach the line to the spool and roll up the line
tasks.description:
Attach the line securely to the spool.
Press and hold the button on the winch housing to roll up the line.

Confirm, spool spins smoothly, no abnormal noise, line is undamaged and knot-free.

tasks.title: WINCH: Put the MedKit in position before rolling up the last line
tasks.description:
Before rolling up the final part of the line, place the MedKit in the correct position.
Ensure the MedKit is resting on the front brace.

tasks.title: WINCH: Pull out the MedKit locking pin and lift the MedKit until the pin can be locked
tasks.description:
Pull out the locking pin and carefully lift the MedKit into the locking position.
Lock the pin securely and verify it is fully seated.

tasks.title: WINCH: Attach magnetic connector to MedKit and verify blue lights
tasks.description:
Attach the magnetic connector to the front right of the MedKit.
Verify the connection is secure by the navlights turning blue.
Assure that the button is set to ON.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Verify visual navigation markers are clean
tasks.description: Ensure the visual navigation markers are clean.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Verify enclosure vegetation does not pose a risk for the drone
tasks.description: Confirm the enclosure is not overgrown with foliage or grass.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Verify Skybase low pressure pins are aligned
tasks.description:
Confirm that the pins on the indoor sides of the ports are aligned with the corresponding loop.
This pin will lock the doors in place if the pressure is lost.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Ensure Skybase area is clean and safe
tasks.description:
Secure all tools.
Remove any debris inside the Skybase.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Verify lights are working
tasks.description:
Check that the lights inside the Skybase are operational.
If applicable, verify external lights are working.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Restock utilities if needed
tasks.description: If any item has run out, please note in TI request that it needs restocking.

tasks.title: SKYBASE: Clean RemoteTI cameras
tasks.description: With a microfiber cloth clean all 8 of the dome cameras in the corners of the hangar.

tasks.title: INSTRUCTION: Take a final look to ensure everything is OK
tasks.description:
Ensure the Ethernet port cap is screwed on.
Confirm the drone is perfectly aligned.
Confirm lids are securely screwed on.

tasks.title: PRS: Arm the parachute system safely
tasks.description:
ALWAYS WEAR SAFETY GOGGLES AND HEARING PROTECTION WHEN HANDLING THE PRS FUSE.
Switch the parachute fuse below the PRS tube to "DANGER".
After arming the PRS, DO NOT approach the drone.

tasks.title: DOCUMENTATION: Record any abnormalities in the Adverse Events form
tasks.description:
Fill out the Adverse Events form for any abnormalities found.
Link: https://forms.gle/NF1nVe6F9GGWq5fZ8
